decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (P(1)01 A and P(1)02 A. Design and Access Statement ref. 140861-925, Planning Statement dated January 2017 and  Transport Statement by entran received on 06/02/2017. P(1)09 B received on 03/04/2017. P(1)03 G and P(1)10 B received on 13/04/2017.) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - No fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - The swept path for delivery vehicles shown on the approved plans shall be kept clear from all other materials, including the parking of non-delivery vehicles, at all times.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of development, a Car Park and Cycle Parking Management Plan, detailing the monitoring and management of the car and cycle parking on site, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and monitoring reports shall be made available to the Local Authority on request.  If the monitoring reports demonstrate that on average 50% of the approved cycle parking spaces are occupied, over a rolling monthly period, additional cycle parking spaces, to meet the current London Plan standards, shall be provided within 3 months and thereafter retained as such

Condition : 6 - The cycle parking facilities shall be installed in accordance with the approved plan reference P(1)03 G, made available for use prior to the first beneficial use of the enlarged building as herby approved and so maintained at all times thereafter

Condition : 7 - The warehouse facilities hereby approved (shown shaded in green on the plan 140861 P(1)03 G and labelled 'Warehouse ') shall not be used other than as storage ancillary to the use of the premises as a retail store (Use Class A1) and for the avoidance of doubt that floorspace shall not be used for the retail sale of goods or otherwise be accessed by members of the public.
description: Erection of a single storey rear extension and external alterations to existing store, including alterations to elevational treatment and shopfront, minor alterations to the carpark and soft landscaping.
